intro: Beyeria brevifolia var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-leaved beyeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically clustered in whorled inflorescences, displaying shades of pink to purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
